Pre-Game Insights: Detroit Pistons have improved their defense, letting in an average of 114.6 points per game compared to 119 last season.
Detroit Pistons' offense has also improved, with the team scoring 112 points per game, up from 109.9 last season.
Cade Cunningham, the No. 1 pick in the 2021 draft, has improved. So far this season, the guard is averaging 23.8 points and 9.7 assists, which are both personal bests.
Charlotte Hornets haven't made much progress under their new head coach, Charles Lee.
Charlotte's defense is ranked 16th in the league, with an average passer rating of 112.8 points per game.
On offense, Charlotte is 29-and-over with 106.2 points scored per game.
Others: The article provides expert betting tips for the match, favoring Detroit Pistons and suggesting a total under, a bet on Detroit for assists, and a bet on H1 (-6.5) and H1 (-1.5) assists.
